attributes.action: review the comensation law for persons made disabled following ruitine operations and increase the time limit from 3 years to 10 years
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: since my operation in 2000, i tried to claim compensation from the nhs within the 3 year time limit, i was basically fobbed of with the excuse: 1 in 5 patients suffer severe nerve damage: which meant i had no leg to stand on if i persued my claim, since then and after seeing severel doctors/specialists for ongoing treatment "who themselves were disgusted with the way i had been treated, i have met severel people with the same type of problem or very much alike, this is very unfair espescially when your informed that the problems recieved are worse than that informed of in the beginning, "i thought the nhs were supposed be there to help", "after 8 years i have just been informed the reasons i am in so much pain at all times is because i"ve suffererd a degree of spinal cord damage",during the operation. why should the nhs use their powers in such a way and get away with it? therefore i am writing to try and get the law changed to help the thousands of people like myself.
